title: Tennessee Landlord-Tenant Law Reference
disclaimer: This is informational only and does not constitute legal advice. Consult a licensed attorney for legal guidance.

urlta.name: Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act (URLTA)
urlta.appliesTo: Counties with population >= 75,000 (Davidson, Shelby, Knox, Hamilton, etc.)

66-28-103.title: Definitions
66-28-103.summary: Defines key terms including 'landlord', 'tenant', 'premises', 'rent', and 'security deposit'

66-28-104.title: Jurisdiction
66-28-104.summary: General Sessions Court has jurisdiction over detainer warrants and eviction proceedings

66-28-201.title: Landlord Obligations
66-28-201.summary: Landlords must maintain fit premises, comply with building codes, and keep facilities in working order
tenantRights: Right to working plumbing, heating, and electrical systems
Right to notice before landlord entry (except emergencies)

66-28-301.title: Tenant Obligations
66-28-301.summary: Tenants must pay rent, keep premises clean, and comply with lease terms

66-28-304.title: Security Deposits
66-28-304.summary: Landlords must return security deposit within 30 days of lease termination, with itemized deductions
keyPoints: Must be deposited in FDIC-insured bank
Landlord must notify tenant of deposit location
Itemized statement required for deductions
Wrongful withholding = liability for deposit amount

66-28-501.title: Noncompliance by Landlord
66-28-501.summary: Tenant remedies when landlord fails to maintain premises
remedies: May terminate lease if not cured

66-28-502.title: Landlord's Right to Terminate - Nonpayment
66-28-502.summary: Landlord may terminate for nonpayment of rent
keyPoints: Notice must state rent due and owing
Notice must demand possession
Tenant may pay within 14 days to avoid termination
After 14 days, landlord may file detainer warrant

66-28-503.title: Landlord's Right to Terminate - Lease Violation
66-28-503.summary: Landlord may terminate for breach of lease terms
66-28-503.noticeRequired: 30 days written notice for lease violations
keyPoints: Notice must specify the violation
Tenant has opportunity to cure violation
Serious violations (illegal activity) may have shorter notice

66-28-512.title: Recovery of Possession
66-28-512.summary: Landlord must use judicial process to evict

nonUrlta.name: Non-URLTA Counties
nonUrlta.description: Counties with population < 75,000 follow common law landlord-tenant principles
nonUrlta.notes: Local court rules may vary; consult local legal aid for specific procedures

detainerWarrant.name: Detainer Warrant Proceedings
detainerWarrant.summary: Legal process for landlord to recover possession of rental property
keyPoints: Filed in General Sessions Court
Must state grounds for eviction
Hearing typically within 6-10 days
Judgment for possession if tenant fails to appear or defend
10-day appeal period
Writ of possession after appeal period expires

selfHelpEviction.name: Self-Help Eviction Prohibition
selfHelpEviction.summary: Landlords cannot use self-help methods to remove tenants
remedies: May be entitled to recover actual damages plus up to 3 months rent

retaliatoryEviction.name: Retaliatory Eviction Protection
retaliatoryEviction.summary: Landlord cannot evict in retaliation for tenant exercising legal rights
protectedActivities: Exercising legal rights under lease or law

noticePeriods.name: Required Notice Periods
noticePeriods.summary: Minimum notice periods required under Tennessee law

nonpayment.notes: Tenant may cure by paying all rent due within the 14-day period

leaseViolation.type: Written notice to cure or vacate
leaseViolation.notes: Must specify the nature of the violation

appeals.name: Appeal Rights
appeals.summary: Right to appeal General Sessions Court judgment
keyPoints: 10 calendar days to file appeal
Must post appeal bond (typically equal to judgment plus costs)
Appeal heard in Circuit Court
May request jury trial on appeal

writOfPossession.name: Writ of Possession
writOfPossession.summary: Court order authorizing sheriff to remove tenant
writOfPossession.timeline: Issued after 10-day appeal period expires or appeal is resolved

defenses.description: Landlord failed to provide required 14-day written notice
defenses.howToRaise: File answer alleging insufficient notice; request dismissal

defenses.description: All rent due was paid within the 14-day notice period
defenses.howToRaise: Provide receipts showing payment before deadline

defenses.description: Premises not maintained in habitable condition
defenses.howToRaise: Document conditions; show landlord was notified; may offset rent

defenses.description: Landlord accepted partial payment after notice, waiving right to evict
defenses.howToRaise: Show acceptance of payment after notice was served

defenses.description: Amount claimed includes improper charges (late fees not in lease, etc.)
defenses.howToRaise: Review lease terms; challenge improper fees

defenses.description: Eviction filed in response to tenant exercising legal rights
defenses.howToRaise: Show timing between protected activity and eviction filing

defenses.description: Landlord failed to provide required 30-day written notice
defenses.howToRaise: File answer alleging insufficient notice period

defenses.description: Tenant cured the violation within notice period
defenses.howToRaise: Document compliance; show violation was remedied

defenses.description: Alleged violation did not occur or does not violate lease
defenses.howToRaise: Review lease terms; present evidence disproving violation

defenses.description: Landlord enforces provision against tenant but not others
defenses.howToRaise: Document inconsistent enforcement of lease terms

defenses.description: Landlord breached lease before alleged tenant violation
Landlord failed to provide required 30-day notice to terminate
Landlord's actions created a new tenancy
defenses.howToRaise: Show acceptance of rent after lease end; evidence of renewal agreement

defenses.description: Landlord's conduct led tenant to believe tenancy would continue
Tenant did not know of and could not reasonably have known of activity
defenses.howToRaise: Show tenant was unaware and had no reason to know

defenses.description: Tenant took prompt action to stop activity after learning of it
defenses.howToRaise: Document actions taken to address situation
